recipe_22501.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense free items. This model can dispense up to 10 of a single kind of item.
recipe_22501.Name: Simple Item Dispenser

recipe_22502.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense free items. This model can dispense up to 1000 of a single kind of item.
recipe_22502.Name: Large-Capacity Item Dispenser

recipe_22503.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense free items. This model can dispense up to 1000 of a single kind of item and has a place for a custom message that all visitors will see.

recipe_22504.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense items and collect currency. This model can sell up to 10 of a single kind of item.
recipe_22504.Name: Simple Item Vendor

recipe_22505.Description: An elaborate contraption that can dispense items and collect currency. This model can sell up to 1000 of a single kind of item.
recipe_22505.Name: Large-Capacity Item Vendor

recipe_22506.Name: Fancy Item Vendor

recipe_22521.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense free raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 10 free raffle tickets for a single item (or item stack).
recipe_22521.Name: Simple Free Item Raffler

recipe_22522.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense free raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 20 free raffle tickets for 1 or 2 items (or item stacks) and/or a small cash prize.
recipe_22522.Name: Modest Free Item Raffler

recipe_22523.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 30 raffle tickets for up to 3 items (or item stacks) and/or a cash prize. The raffle tickets can be free or can cost Councils.
recipe_22523.Name: Standard Item Raffler

recipe_22524.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 50 raffle tickets for up to 6 items (or item stacks) and/or a cash prize. The raffle tickets can be free or can cost Councils. This model has a place for an inscription that is displayed to each user.
recipe_22524.Name: Fancy Item Raffler

recipe_22525.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 100 raffle tickets for up to 8 items (or item stacks) and/or a cash prize. The raffle tickets can be free or can cost Councils. This model has a place for an inscription that is displayed to each user, and a message that is shown only to the winner. This model can also be configured to have a time limit of 1-60 minutes.
recipe_22525.Name: Advanced Item Raffler

recipe_22526.Description:
An elaborate contraption that can dispense raffle tickets and then deliver a reward to the raffle winner.

This model can dispense up to 1000 raffle tickets for up to 10 items (or item stacks) and/or a cash prize. The raffle tickets can be free or can cost Councils. This model has a place for an inscription that is displayed to each user, and a message that is shown only to the winner. This model can also be configured to have a time limit of 1-90 minutes.
recipe_22526.Name: Ultra Item Raffler

recipe_22541.Description: Creates some single-use traps that will stun an enemy that wanders over it. Works on pretty much anything, not just rats. (Except for Elites.)
recipe_22541.Name: Paralyzing Rat Trap

recipe_23201.Description: Analyze a piece of equipment to study how it works. The item is not lost or damaged. You can only study each type of item one time -- further study of similar items gains you nothing. You can only perform Hoplology Research once every 5 minutes.
recipe_23201.Name: Hoplology Research

recipe_23251.Description: Study the bones, organs, or body parts of a deceased creature to get a hint about your future. You may not like what you see, but the odds of a good omen are in your favor.
recipe_23251.Name: Beginner's Augury

recipe_23252.Description: Study the bones, organs, or body parts of a deceased creature to get a hint about your future. You may not like what you see, but the odds of a good omen are in your favor. This augury tends to have more potent futures -- both good and ill -- than the Beginner's Augury.
recipe_23252.Name: Basic Augury

recipe_23253.Description: Study the bones, organs, or body parts of a deceased creature to get a hint about your future. You may not like what you see, but the odds of a good omen are in your favor. This augury tends to have more potent futures -- both good and ill -- than the Basic Augury. It is also more sensitive to the body part used, with more possible outcomes for certain parts.
recipe_23253.Name: Advanced Augury

recipe_23254.Description: Study the bones, organs, or body parts of a deceased creature to get a hint about your future. You may not like what you see, but the odds of a good omen are in your favor. This augury tends to have more potent futures -- both good and ill -- than the Advanced Augury. Like the Advanced Augury, it is sensitive to the body part used, with more possible outcomes for certain parts.
recipe_23254.Name: Expert Augury

recipe_23271.Description:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned monsters 3 seconds before they actually appear.

The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.
recipe_23271.Name: Perceive Spawn Premonitions (3 secs)
recipe_23271.ResultString:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned monsters 3 seconds before they actually appear.
The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.

recipe_23272.Description:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned monsters 5 seconds before they actually appear.

The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.
recipe_23272.Name: Perceive Spawn Premonitions (5 secs)
recipe_23272.ResultString:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned monsters 5 seconds before they actually appear.
The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.

recipe_23273.Description:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned corporeal undead 10 seconds before they actually appear.

The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.
recipe_23273.Name: Perceive Undead Spawn Premonitions (10 secs)
recipe_23273.ResultString:
Perform a mind-altering ritual so that you can perceive newly-spawned corporeal undead 10 seconds before they actually appear.
The effect does not wear off, but whenever you die there's a 5% chance that it will end.

recipe_23601.Description: Dump out a beer keg and clean the container so it can be used again. There's a small chance that the container will be too damaged to be reused.
recipe_23601.Name: Reuse Beer Keg

recipe_23602.Description: Dump out a cask of hard liquor and clean the container so it can be used again. There's a small chance the barrel will be too damaged to be reused.
recipe_23602.Name: Reuse Liquor Barrel

recipe_23603.Description: Attach a tap to a barrel of beer or hard liquor and deploy it. The barrel will IMMEDIATELY APPEAR near you, and any players can drink from it. The barrel will persist until all alcohol is consumed (or very slowly evaporates). The barrel cannot be reused. If the barrel is inscribed prior to being tapped, the inscription will be shown to all who drink from it.

Ingredients.Desc: Beer Keg or Hard Liquor Barrel

recipe_23603.Name: Tap Alcohol Keg

recipe_23801.Description: A very rough alcoholic beverage. Some say you grow to like the taste, but others say that's just your tastebuds dying from the pain.

Ingredients.Desc: Fruit: Red Apple, Grapes, or Orange
Mushroom Flakes: Parasol, Mycena, Boletus, or Field
Boar Tusk, Cat Eyeball, Snail Sinews, Rat Tail, or Basic Fish Scales
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

recipe_23801.Name: Potato Vodka (Drinkable Cask)

recipe_23802.Description: Apple brandy, with a distinctive apple taste and a strong kick. A longtime favorite of rural humans.

Ingredients.Desc: Fruit: Red Apple, Grapes, or Orange
Boar Tusk, Cat Eyeball, Snail Sinews, Rat Tail, or Basic Fish Scales
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

recipe_23802.Name: Applejack (Drinkable Cask)

recipe_23803.Description: A sweet, relatively palatable variety of vodka. Although it's a traditional dwarven drink, it long ago fell out of favor, and these days dwarves only use it for cooking.

Ingredients.Desc: Mushroom Flakes: Parasol, Mycena, Boletus, or Field
Boar Tusk, Cat Eyeball, Snail Sinews, Rat Tail, or Basic Fish Scales
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

recipe_23803.Name: Beet Vodka (Drinkable Cask)

recipe_23804.Description: Sweet and strong, with the distinctive odor of molasses. In far-off lands, ranalon produce and drink rum in tremendous quantities, but it's less common -- and less delicious -- in Alharth.

Ingredients.Desc: Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood
Boar Tusk, Cat Eyeball, Snail Sinews, Rat Tail, or Basic Fish Scales
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

recipe_23804.Name: Pale Rum (Drinkable Cask)

recipe_23805.Description: A simple variety of whisky made from barley. It's drinkable and has a tolerable flavor.

Ingredients.Desc: Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood
Wolf Teeth, Panther Tail, Deinonychus Claw, Rabbit's Foot, or Bear Gallbladder
Oregano, Mandrake Root, Peppercorns or Grass

recipe_23805.Name: Whisky (Drinkable Cask)

recipe_23806.Description: Fermented cactus juice with a complex taste. This variety has been aged to make it more drinkable. (It's "more" drinkable, but still not "very" drinkable -- it's an acquired taste.) The stereotypical drink of rakshasa desert bandits.

Ingredients.Desc: Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Field, Blusher, Milk Cap, Blood
Wolf Teeth, Panther Tail, Deinonychus Claw, Rabbit's Foot, or Bear Gallbladder
Cinnamon, Muntok Peppercorns, Seaweed, or Myconian Jelly

recipe_23806.Name: Tequila (Drinkable Cask)

recipe_23807.Description: Pleasant, slightly citrusy, but with a distinctive bitterness too. It's said to be the favorite hard liquor of elves, but since elves mostly drink wine, that's not much praise.

Ingredients.Desc: Fruit: Pear, Peach, or Green Apple
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Coral, Groxmax, Porcini, Black Foot Morel
Wolf Teeth, Panther Tail, Deinonychus Claw, Rabbit's Foot, or Bear Gallbladder
Cinnamon, Muntok Peppercorns, Seaweed, or Myconian Jelly

recipe_23807.Name: Dry Gin (Drinkable Cask)

recipe_23808.Description: Made from fermented corn mash, this is very mellow and drinkable. This is the favored drink of Councilwoman Sereel "The Steel" Avenbule. She holds a bourbon competition each year in Vidaria.

Ingredients.Desc: Fruit: Pear, Peach, or Green Apple
Mushroom Flakes/Powders: Coral, Groxmax, Porcini, Black Foot Morel
Cockatrice Beak, Worm Tooth, Ectoplasm, Powdered Mammal, or Barghest Flesh
Mint, Honey, Juniper Berries, or Almonds

recipe_23808.Name: Bourbon (Drinkable Cask)

recipe_23851.Description: Although there might be delicious varieties of strawberry wine out there somewhere, this is not it: the strawberry flavor is undermined by a grassy taste.
recipe_23851.Name: Strawberry Wine (Cask)

recipe_23852.Description: A drinkable wine, but with a slightly musky taste and odor. This is definitely not the kind of wine that elves drink in Verta! But it's not horrible.
recipe_23852.Name: Concord Wine (Cask)

recipe_23853.Description: With notes of citrus and sweetness, this is a decent table wine.
recipe_23853.Name: Orange Wine (Cask)

recipe_23854.Description: Given that it was made from carrots, this wine is... surprisingly good!
recipe_23854.Name: Carrot Wine (Cask)

recipe_23855.Description: A buttery, banana-flavored wine that's quite a mouthful.
recipe_23855.Name: Banana Wine (Cask)

recipe_23857.Description: A very dry wine that's quite drinkable.
recipe_23857.Name: Rice Wine (Cask)

recipe_23858.Description: A dry wine. It has a slightly piney smell, but it's not pleasant.
recipe_23858.Name: Juniper Wine (Cask)

recipe_8501.Description: Manually remove the seeds from cotton and stretch it out for yarn production. This manual method is extremely slow compared to using a cotton gin.
recipe_8501.Name: Carded Cotton

recipe_8502.Description: Remove the seeds and prepare cotton with a cotton gin. 35% of the time you also manage to collect enough quality fibers to make a bundle of Perfect Cotton, too. (Must be near a cotton gin.)
recipe_8502.Name: Carded Cotton (from Cotton Gin)

recipe_8503.Description: Remove the seeds and prepare cotton with a cotton gin. Because of your expert skill, there is a higher chance of obtaining Perfect Cotton. (Must be near a cotton gin.)
recipe_8503.Name: Carded Cotton (Expert Level)

recipe_8504.Description: Remove the seeds and prepare cotton with a cotton gin. Because of your master skill, less raw cotton is required. (Must be near a cotton gin.)
recipe_8504.Name: Carded Cotton (Master Level)

recipe_8521.Description: Create rough yarn from prepared cotton.
recipe_8521.Name: Coarse Cotton Yarn

recipe_8522.Description: Create smooth yarn from prepared cotton.
recipe_8522.Name: Fine Cotton Yarn

recipe_8523.Description: Create a spool of thread from fine yarn and spider's web. This recipe creates 4 spools of thread.
recipe_8523.Name: Cotton Thread

recipe_8524.Description: Cotton cloth that's extremely porous. Ideal for butter and certain cheeses.
recipe_8524.Name: Butter Muslin

recipe_8525.Description: Cotton cloth that's very porous. Ideal for use in creating mold cheeses.
recipe_8525.Name: Voile Muslin

recipe_8526.Description: Porous cotton that's resistant to heat. Ideal for creating hard cheeses.
recipe_8526.Name: Cheesecloth

recipe_8527.Description: Porous cotton that's resistant to heat. Ideal for creating mold cheeses that take a long time to ripen.
recipe_8527.Name: Fine Cheesecloth

recipe_8533.Description: A sticky cloth that's ideal for certain types of clothing.
recipe_8533.Name: Spider Silk

recipe_8534.Description: This strange cloth is smooth and cool to the touch.
recipe_8534.Name: Strong Spider Silk

recipe_8535.Description: This strange cloth is luxurious to the touch, yet incredibly strong.
recipe_8535.Name: Extreme Spider Silk

recipe_8536.Description: This strange cloth is luxurious to the touch, yet incredibly strong.

recipe_9001.Description: Ties your soul to a particular Teleportation Circle so that you can return to it via Teleportation magic. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
recipe_9001.Name: Bind Circle

recipe_9002.Description: Sends you back to the Teleportation Circle you are bound to. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
recipe_9002.Name: Recall Circle

recipe_9003.Description: Sends you back to the Teleportation Circle you are bound to. You do not need to be in a Teleportation Circle to use this technique, but this technique has a 60-minute cooldown before it can be used again.
recipe_9003.Name: Recall Circle (Improvised)

recipe_9005.Description: Teleports you to the entrance of the area you're currently in.
recipe_9005.Name: Recall Beginnings

recipe_9006.Description: Sends you back to the Teleportation Circle you last Recalled to. (Normally this would be the one you are bound to, unless you've bound to a different location since your last teleport.) You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
recipe_9006.Name: Recall Last Recall

recipe_9007.Description: Sends you to a Teleportation Circle that you have recalled to relatively recently. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
recipe_9007.Name: Recall Somewhere

recipe_9008.Description: Sends you to the Teleportation Circle that you have recalled to the highest number of times in your life. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
recipe_9008.Name: Recall Heart's Home

recipe_9009.Description: Ties your soul to a particular Teleportation Circle so that you can return to it via "Recall Alternate Circle". You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
recipe_9009.Name: Bind Alternate Circle

recipe_901.Description: Prepare basic fertilizer, suitable for fertilizing simple flowers and some vegetables. Creates three doses.
recipe_901.Name: Basic Fertilizer (from Dirt)

recipe_9010.Description: Sends you back to the alternate Teleportation Circle you are bound to. You must be standing on a Teleportation Circle.
recipe_9010.Name: Recall Alternate Circle

recipe_9011.Description: Teleports you to the entrance of the area you're currently in.
recipe_9011.Name: Recall Beginnings (Hardcore)

recipe_9012.Description: Teleports you back to wherever your guild's home position is set to. Costs 2 Guild Credits. (Note: currently all guilds' home positions are in Rahu, but eventually they will be able to pick from different cities.)
recipe_9012.Name: Return to Guild Hall

recipe_902.Description: An alternate way to create basic fertilizer that uses a whole bunch of bone meal as the key ingredient. Creates three doses.
recipe_902.Name: Basic Fertilizer (from Bone)

recipe_9020.Description: Sends you back to the alternate Teleportation Circle you are bound to. You do not need to be in a Teleportation Circle to use this technique, but this technique has a 60-minute cooldown before it can be used again.
recipe_9020.Name: Recall Alternate Circle (Improvised)

recipe_9021.Description: Creates a dimensional rift that leads to your bound Teleportation Circle. Any number of players can enter the rift. It lasts for two minutes. This technique has a 60-minute cooldown before it can be used again.
recipe_9021.Name: Summon Portal

recipe_9022.Description: Creates a dimensional rift that leads to your alternate-bound Teleportation Circle. Any number of players can enter the rift. It lasts for two minutes. This technique has a 60-minute cooldown before it can be used again.
recipe_9022.Name: Summon Alternate Portal

recipe_903.Description: An alternate way to create basic fertilizer that uses rotten meat as the key ingredient. Creates three doses.
recipe_903.Name: Basic Fertilizer (from Rotten Meat)

recipe_904.Description: Sift through a pile of grass, looking for plantable barley seeds. Yields between 0 and 3 seeds.
recipe_904.Name: Sift Through Grass For Barley Seeds

recipe_9051.Description: Summon a special druidic storage container. Must be near a teleportation platform. This can be used during a druidic emergency and up to an hour before or after the emergency.
recipe_9051.Name: Summon Druidic Storage (12-slot)

recipe_9052.Description: Summon a special druidic storage container. Must be near a teleportation platform. This can be used during a druidic emergency and up to an hour before or after the emergency.
recipe_9052.Name: Summon Druidic Storage (20-slot)

recipe_9081.Description: Sends you from one mushroom circle to another mushroom circle in your current area.

recipe_9082.Description: While standing in a mushroom circle, return to the fae realm. Can be cast once per 15 minutes.
recipe_9082.Name: (Fae Only) Return to Fae Realm

recipe_9083.Description: Ties your soul to a particular mushroom circle so that you can return via Teleportation magic. You must be standing in a mushroom circle. Costs 10 Fae Energy.
recipe_9083.Name: (Fae Only) Mushroom-Circle Bind

recipe_9085.Description: Teleports you to the entrance of the area you're currently in.
recipe_9085.Name: (Fae Only) Recall Beginnings

This recipe (or the corresponding un-recall recipe) can be used once per 40 hours, except during the New Moon, when it can be used every 10 hours.

Elves gain +7% Combat XP when clean and -7% Combat XP when filthy. Duration: 4 hours.

Once deployed, display lasts 5 minutes and can be used by any number of players that have at least Nature Appreciation 30.
recipe_9735.Name: Cleanliness Display #5

A subdued arrangement of flowers that reduces feelings of rage and hate, allowing greater focus in combat.

Grants +5 Melee Accuracy. Orcs also gain +3% Combat XP. Duration: 4 hours.

You can only have one flower arrangement benefit at a time.
